metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1679 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Atheros wirelessadapter driver in the way a user forces the ath9k_htc_wait_for_targetfunction to fail with some input messages. This flaw allows a local user tocrash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-generic - 4.4.0-229.263
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-229-lowlatency - 4.4.0-229.263
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
